main.name: Oliver  Mensah
main.description: I currently develop mobile apps, desktop, web Applications as well as web services and API's.
main.bio: I am Computer Science student  and would-be senior at Ashesi University, hopefully graduating in summer 2018.During summer 2016,I interned as a software developer for iSpace Foundation, where I worked on a project meant to hub dataset about Ghana.My Computer Science interests include artificial intelligence,distributed systems,web application development and virtual reality.

education.description: Ashesi's Computer Science programme focuses not only on software design and programming, but also on empowering young people to be at the forefront of African growth by harnessing the power of technology.

work.title: Facebook Developer Circle Accra, Co-Lead
work.description: Developer Circles is a community-driven program that's free to join and open to coders, programmers, Software Developers, students, etc. Each Developer Circle is led by members of the local community who act as leads for the circle, organizing events offline and managing a local online Facebook community.  Developer Circles are forums to share knowledge, collaborate, build new ideas, and learn about the latest technologies from Facebook and other industry leaders.  As a Co-Lead,  I coordinate with Facebook on promoting the ecosystem of technology in Ghana, organize technology events like Meetups, Hackathons, train other developers on Facebook Technologies like React, React Native, etc

work.title: Software Developer | Summer Intern
work.description: worked with a team of 3 to develop a platform to help in data collation and analysis. We used Go to handle the backend

work.title: Technical Officer || Summer Intern
work.description: Worked with a team of 5 during my internship.  I was responsible for creating web services with Golang. Later, trained 3 newly interns on Golang, in order to contribute to the project we were working on.
